Functions.Name: get_file_extension
Functions.Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_file_extension(path text)
 RETURNS text
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 IMMUTABLE
AS $function$ BEGIN
    RETURN substring(path FROM '\.([^\.]*)$');
END; $function$

Functions.Name: path_prefixes
Functions.Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.path_prefixes(path text)
 RETURNS text[]
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 IMMUTABLE
AS $function$ BEGIN
    RETURN (
        SELECT array_agg(array_to_string(components[:len], '/')) prefixes
        FROM
            (SELECT regexp_split_to_array(path, E'/') components) t,
            generate_series(1, array_length(components, 1)) AS len
    );
END; $function$

Functions.Name: singleton
Functions.Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.singleton(value text)
 RETURNS text[]
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 IMMUTABLE
AS $function$ BEGIN
    RETURN ARRAY[value];
END; $function$

Functions.Name: singleton_integer
Functions.Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.singleton_integer(value integer)
 RETURNS integer[]
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
 IMMUTABLE
AS $function$ BEGIN
    RETURN ARRAY[value];
END; $function$

Functions.Name: update_codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions_insert
Functions.Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions_insert()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$ BEGIN
    INSERT INTO codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions
    SELECT
        upload_id,
        MIN(schema_version) as min_schema_version,
        MAX(schema_version) as max_schema_version
    FROM newtab
    JOIN codeintel_scip_documents ON codeintel_scip_documents.id = newtab.document_id
    GROUP BY newtab.upload_id
    ON CONFLICT (upload_id) DO UPDATE SET
        -- Update with min(old_min, new_min) and max(old_max, new_max)
        min_schema_version = LEAST(codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions.min_schema_version, EXCLUDED.min_schema_version),
        max_schema_version = GREATEST(codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions.max_schema_version, EXCLUDED.max_schema_version);
    RETURN NULL;
END $function$

Functions.Name: update_codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs_delete
Functions.Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs_delete()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$ BEGIN
    INSERT INTO codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs (document_id)
    SELECT document_id FROM oldtab;
    RETURN NULL;
END $function$

Functions.Name: update_codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions_insert
Functions.Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions_insert()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$ BEGIN
    INSERT INTO codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions
    SELECT
        newtab.upload_id,
        MIN(codeintel_scip_documents.schema_version) as min_schema_version,
        MAX(codeintel_scip_documents.schema_version) as max_schema_version
    FROM newtab
    JOIN codeintel_scip_documents ON codeintel_scip_documents.id = newtab.document_id
    GROUP BY newtab.upload_id
    ON CONFLICT (upload_id) DO UPDATE SET
        -- Update with min(old_min, new_min) and max(old_max, new_max)
        min_schema_version = LEAST(codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions.min_schema_version, EXCLUDED.min_schema_version),
        max_schema_version = GREATEST(codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions.max_schema_version, EXCLUDED.max_schema_version);
    RETURN NULL;
END $function$

Functions.Name: update_codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions_insert
Functions.Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions_insert()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$ BEGIN
    INSERT INTO codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions
    SELECT
        upload_id,
        MIN(schema_version) as min_schema_version,
        MAX(schema_version) as max_schema_version
    FROM newtab
    GROUP BY upload_id
    ON CONFLICT (upload_id) DO UPDATE SET
        -- Update with min(old_min, new_min) and max(old_max, new_max)
        min_schema_version = LEAST(codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions.min_schema_version, EXCLUDED.min_schema_version),
        max_schema_version = GREATEST(codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions.max_schema_version, EXCLUDED.max_schema_version);
    RETURN NULL;
END $function$

Functions.Name: update_lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions_insert
Functions.Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions_insert()
 RETURNS trigger
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$ BEGIN
    INSERT INTO
        lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions
    SELECT
        dump_id,
        MIN(schema_version) as min_schema_version,
        MAX(schema_version) as max_schema_version
    FROM
        newtab
    GROUP BY
        dump_id
    ON CONFLICT (dump_id) DO UPDATE SET
        -- Update with min(old_min, new_min) and max(old_max, new_max)
        min_schema_version = LEAST(lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions.min_schema_version, EXCLUDED.min_schema_version),
        max_schema_version = GREATEST(lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions.max_schema_version, EXCLUDED.max_schema_version);

    RETURN NULL;
END $function$

END $function$

Functions.Name: update_lsif_data_implementations_schema_versions_insert

        max_schema_version = GREATEST(lsif_data_implementations_schema_versions.max_schema_version, EXCLUDED.max_schema_version);

Functions.Name: update_lsif_data_references_schema_versions_insert
Functions.Definition:
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.update_lsif_data_references_schema_versions_insert()

AS $function$ BEGIN

        lsif_data_references_schema_versions

        max_schema_version = GREATEST(lsif_data_references_schema_versions.max_schema_version, EXCLUDED.max_schema_version);

    RETURN NULL;
END $function$

Tables.Name: codeintel_last_reconcile
Tables.Comment: Stores the last time processed LSIF data was reconciled with the other database.

Indexes.Name: codeintel_last_reconcile_dump_id_key
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_last_reconcile_dump_id_key ON codeintel_last_reconcile USING btree (dump_id)

Indexes.Name: codeintel_last_reconcile_last_reconcile_at_dump_id
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX codeintel_last_reconcile_last_reconcile_at_dump_id ON codeintel_last_reconcile USING btree (last_reconcile_at, dump_id)

Tables.Name: codeintel_scip_document_lookup
Tables.Comment: A mapping from file paths to document references within a particular SCIP index.

Columns.Name: document_id
Columns.Comment: The foreign key to the shared document payload (see the table [`codeintel_scip_document_lookup`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_document_lookup)).

Columns.Name: document_path
Columns.Comment: The file path to the document relative to the root of the index.

Columns.Name: id
Columns.Comment: An auto-generated identifier. This column is used as a foreign key target to reduce occurrences of the full document path value.

Columns.Name: upload_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the upload that provided this SCIP index.

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_document_lookup_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_document_lookup_pkey ON codeintel_scip_document_lookup USING btree (id)

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_document_lookup_upload_id_document_path_key
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_document_lookup_upload_id_document_path_key ON codeintel_scip_document_lookup USING btree (upload_id, document_path)

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_document_lookup_document_id
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX codeintel_scip_document_lookup_document_id ON codeintel_scip_document_lookup USING hash (document_id)

Triggers.Name: codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions_insert
Triggers.Definition: CREATE TRIGGER codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions_insert AFTER INSERT ON codeintel_scip_document_lookup REFERENCING NEW TABLE AS newtab FOR EACH STATEMENT EXECUTE FUNCTION update_codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions_insert()

Triggers.Name: codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs_insert
Triggers.Definition: CREATE TRIGGER codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs_insert AFTER DELETE ON codeintel_scip_document_lookup REFERENCING OLD TABLE AS oldtab FOR EACH STATEMENT EXECUTE FUNCTION update_codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs_delete()

Triggers.Name: codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions_insert
Triggers.Definition: CREATE TRIGGER codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions_insert AFTER INSERT ON codeintel_scip_document_lookup REFERENCING NEW TABLE AS newtab FOR EACH STATEMENT EXECUTE FUNCTION update_codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions_insert()

Tables.Name: codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions
Tables.Comment: Tracks the range of `schema_versions` values associated with each SCIP index in the [`codeintel_scip_document_lookup`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_document_lookup) table.

Columns.Name: max_schema_version
Columns.Comment: An upper-bound on the `schema_version` values of the records in the table [`codeintel_scip_document_lookup`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_document_lookup) where the `upload_id` column matches the associated SCIP index.

Columns.Name: min_schema_version
Columns.Comment: A lower-bound on the `schema_version` values of the records in the table [`codeintel_scip_document_lookup`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_document_lookup) where the `upload_id` column matches the associated SCIP index.

Columns.Name: upload_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the associated SCIP index.

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions_pkey ON codeintel_scip_document_lookup_schema_versions USING btree (upload_id)

Tables.Name: codeintel_scip_documents
Tables.Comment: A lookup of SCIP [Document](https://sourcegraph.com/search?q=context:%40sourcegraph/all+repo:%5Egithub%5C.com/sourcegraph/scip%24+file:%5Escip%5C.proto+message+Document&patternType=standard) payloads by their hash.

Columns.Name: id
Columns.Comment: An auto-generated identifier. This column is used as a foreign key target to reduce occurrences of the full payload hash value.

Columns.Name: payload_hash
Columns.Comment: A deterministic hash of the raw SCIP payload. We use this as a unique value to enforce deduplication between indexes with the same document data.

Columns.Name: raw_scip_payload
Columns.Comment: The raw, canonicalized SCIP [Document](https://sourcegraph.com/search?q=context:%40sourcegraph/all+repo:%5Egithub%5C.com/sourcegraph/scip%24+file:%5Escip%5C.proto+message+Document&patternType=standard) payload.

Columns.Name: schema_version
Columns.Comment: The schema version of this row - used to determine presence and encoding of (future) denormalized data.

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_documents_payload_hash_key
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_documents_payload_hash_key ON codeintel_scip_documents USING btree (payload_hash)

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_documents_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_documents_pkey ON codeintel_scip_documents USING btree (id)

Tables.Name: codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs
Tables.Comment: A list of document rows that were recently dereferenced by the deletion of an index.

Columns.Name: document_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the document that was dereferenced.

Columns.Name: last_removal_time
Columns.Comment: The time that the log entry was inserted.

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs_pkey ON codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs USING btree (id)

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs_last_removal_time_doc
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs_last_removal_time_doc ON codeintel_scip_documents_dereference_logs USING btree (last_removal_time, document_id)

Tables.Name: codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions
Tables.Comment: Tracks the range of `schema_versions` values associated with each document referenced from the [`codeintel_scip_document_lookup`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_document_lookup) table.

Columns.Name: max_schema_version
Columns.Comment: An upper-bound on the `schema_version` values of the document records referenced from the table [`codeintel_scip_document_lookup`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_document_lookup) where the `upload_id` column matches the associated SCIP index.

Columns.Name: min_schema_version
Columns.Comment: A lower-bound on the `schema_version` values of the document records referenced from the table [`codeintel_scip_document_lookup`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_document_lookup) where the `upload_id` column matches the associated SCIP index.

Columns.Name: upload_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the associated SCIP index.

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions_pkey ON codeintel_scip_documents_schema_versions USING btree (upload_id)

Tables.Name: codeintel_scip_metadata
Tables.Comment: Global metadatadata about a single processed upload.

Columns.Name: id
Columns.Comment: An auto-generated identifier.

Columns.Name: protocol_version
Columns.Comment: The version of the SCIP protocol used to encode this index.

Columns.Name: text_document_encoding
Columns.Comment: The encoding of the text documents within this index. May affect range boundaries.

Columns.Name: tool_arguments
Columns.Comment: Command-line arguments that were used to invoke this indexer.

Columns.Name: tool_name
Columns.Comment: Name of the indexer that produced this index.

Columns.Name: tool_version
Columns.Comment: Version of the indexer that produced this index.

Columns.Name: upload_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the upload that provided this SCIP index.

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_metadata_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_metadata_pkey ON codeintel_scip_metadata USING btree (id)

Tables.Name: codeintel_scip_symbol_names
Tables.Comment: Stores a prefix tree of symbol names within a particular upload.

Columns.Name: id
Columns.Comment: An identifier unique within the index for this symbol name segment.

Columns.Name: name_segment
Columns.Comment: The portion of the symbol name that is unique to this symbol and its children.

Columns.Name: prefix_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the segment that forms the prefix of this symbol, if any.

Columns.Name: upload_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the upload that provided this SCIP index.

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_symbol_names_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_symbol_names_pkey ON codeintel_scip_symbol_names USING btree (upload_id, id)

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_symbol_names_upload_id_roots
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX codeintel_scip_symbol_names_upload_id_roots ON codeintel_scip_symbol_names USING btree (upload_id) WHERE prefix_id IS NULL

Indexes.Name: codeisdntel_scip_symbol_names_upload_id_children
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX codeisdntel_scip_symbol_names_upload_id_children ON codeintel_scip_symbol_names USING btree (upload_id, prefix_id) WHERE prefix_id IS NOT NULL

Tables.Name: codeintel_scip_symbols
Tables.Comment: A mapping from SCIP [Symbol names](https://sourcegraph.com/search?q=context:%40sourcegraph/all+repo:%5Egithub%5C.com/sourcegraph/scip%24+file:%5Escip%5C.proto+message+Symbol&patternType=standard) to path and ranges where that symbol occurs within a particular SCIP index.

Columns.Name: definition_ranges
Columns.Comment: An encoded set of ranges within the associated document that have a **definition** relationship to the associated symbol.

Columns.Name: document_lookup_id
Columns.Comment: A reference to the `id` column of [`codeintel_scip_document_lookup`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_document_lookup). Joining on this table yields the document path relative to the index root.

Columns.Name: implementation_ranges
Columns.Comment: An encoded set of ranges within the associated document that have a **implementation** relationship to the associated symbol.

Columns.Name: reference_ranges
Columns.Comment: An encoded set of ranges within the associated document that have a **reference** relationship to the associated symbol.

Columns.Name: schema_version
Columns.Comment: The schema version of this row - used to determine presence and encoding of denormalized data.

Columns.Name: symbol_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the segment that terminates the name of this symbol. See the table [`codeintel_scip_symbol_names`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_symbol_names) on how to reconstruct the full symbol name.

Columns.Name: type_definition_ranges
Columns.Comment: An encoded set of ranges within the associated document that have a **type definition** relationship to the associated symbol.

Columns.Name: upload_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the upload that provided this SCIP index.

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_symbols_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_symbols_pkey ON codeintel_scip_symbols USING btree (upload_id, symbol_id, document_lookup_id)

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_symbols_document_lookup_id
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX codeintel_scip_symbols_document_lookup_id ON codeintel_scip_symbols USING btree (document_lookup_id)

Constraints.Name: codeintel_scip_symbols_document_lookup_id_fk
Constraints.ConstraintDefinition: FOREIGN KEY (document_lookup_id) REFERENCES codeintel_scip_document_lookup(id) ON DELETE CASCADE

Triggers.Name: codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions_insert
Triggers.Definition: CREATE TRIGGER codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions_insert AFTER INSERT ON codeintel_scip_symbols REFERENCING NEW TABLE AS newtab FOR EACH STATEMENT EXECUTE FUNCTION update_codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions_insert()

Tables.Name: codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions
Tables.Comment: Tracks the range of `schema_versions` for each index in the [`codeintel_scip_symbols`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_symbols) table.

Columns.Name: max_schema_version
Columns.Comment: An upper-bound on the `schema_version` values of the records in the table [`codeintel_scip_symbols`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_symbols) where the `upload_id` column matches the associated SCIP index.

Columns.Name: min_schema_version
Columns.Comment: A lower-bound on the `schema_version` values of the records in the table [`codeintel_scip_symbols`](#table-publiccodeintel_scip_symbols) where the `upload_id` column matches the associated SCIP index.

Columns.Name: upload_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the associated SCIP index.

Indexes.Name: codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions_pkey ON codeintel_scip_symbols_schema_versions USING btree (upload_id)

Tables.Name: lsif_data_definitions
Tables.Comment: Associates (document, range) pairs with the import monikers attached to the range.

Columns.Name: data
Columns.Comment: A gob-encoded payload conforming to an array of [LocationData](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph@3.26/-/blob/enterprise/lib/codeintel/semantic/types.go#L106:6) types.

Columns.Name: dump_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the associated dump in the lsif_uploads table (state=completed).

Columns.Name: identifier
Columns.Comment: The moniker identifier.

Columns.Name: num_locations
Columns.Comment: The number of locations stored in the data field.

Columns.Name: schema_version
Columns.Comment: The schema version of this row - used to determine presence and encoding of data.

Columns.Name: scheme
Columns.Comment: The moniker scheme.

Indexes.Name: lsif_data_definitions_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX lsif_data_definitions_pkey ON lsif_data_definitions USING btree (dump_id, scheme, identifier)

Indexes.Name: lsif_data_definitions_dump_id_schema_version
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX lsif_data_definitions_dump_id_schema_version ON lsif_data_definitions USING btree (dump_id, schema_version)

Triggers.Name: lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions_insert
Triggers.Definition: CREATE TRIGGER lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions_insert AFTER INSERT ON lsif_data_definitions REFERENCING NEW TABLE AS newtab FOR EACH STATEMENT EXECUTE FUNCTION update_lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions_insert()

Tables.Name: lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions
Tables.Comment: Tracks the range of schema_versions for each upload in the lsif_data_definitions table.

Columns.Name: dump_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the associated dump in the lsif_uploads table.

Columns.Name: max_schema_version
Columns.Comment: An upper-bound on the `lsif_data_definitions.schema_version` where `lsif_data_definitions.dump_id = dump_id`.

Columns.Name: min_schema_version
Columns.Comment: A lower-bound on the `lsif_data_definitions.schema_version` where `lsif_data_definitions.dump_id = dump_id`.

Indexes.Name: lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions_pkey ON lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions USING btree (dump_id)

Indexes.Name: lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions_dump_id_schema_version_bo
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions_dump_id_schema_version_bo ON lsif_data_definitions_schema_versions USING btree (dump_id, min_schema_version, max_schema_version)

Tables.Name: lsif_data_documents
Tables.Comment: Stores reference, hover text, moniker, and diagnostic data about a particular text document witin a dump.

Columns.Name: data
Columns.Comment: A gob-encoded payload conforming to the [DocumentData](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph@3.26/-/blob/enterprise/lib/codeintel/semantic/types.go#L13:6) type. This field is being migrated across ranges, hovers, monikers, packages, and diagnostics columns and will be removed in a future release of Sourcegraph.

Columns.Name: diagnostics
Columns.Comment: A gob-encoded payload conforming to the [Diagnostics](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph@3.26/-/blob/enterprise/lib/codeintel/semantic/types.go#L18:2) field of the DocumentDatatype.

Columns.Name: dump_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the associated dump in the lsif_uploads table (state=completed).

Columns.Name: hovers
Columns.Comment: A gob-encoded payload conforming to the [HoversResults](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph@3.26/-/blob/enterprise/lib/codeintel/semantic/types.go#L15:2) field of the DocumentDatatype.

Columns.Name: monikers
Columns.Comment: A gob-encoded payload conforming to the [Monikers](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph@3.26/-/blob/enterprise/lib/codeintel/semantic/types.go#L16:2) field of the DocumentDatatype.

Columns.Name: num_diagnostics
Columns.Comment: The number of diagnostics stored in the data field.

Columns.Name: packages
Columns.Comment: A gob-encoded payload conforming to the [PackageInformation](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph@3.26/-/blob/enterprise/lib/codeintel/semantic/types.go#L17:2) field of the DocumentDatatype.

Columns.Name: path
Columns.Comment: The path of the text document relative to the associated dump root.

Columns.Name: ranges
Columns.Comment: A gob-encoded payload conforming to the [Ranges](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph@3.26/-/blob/enterprise/lib/codeintel/semantic/types.go#L14:2) field of the DocumentDatatype.

Columns.Name: schema_version
Columns.Comment: The schema version of this row - used to determine presence and encoding of data.

Indexes.Name: lsif_data_documents_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX lsif_data_documents_pkey ON lsif_data_documents USING btree (dump_id, path)

Indexes.Name: lsif_data_documents_dump_id_schema_version
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE INDEX lsif_data_documents_dump_id_schema_version ON lsif_data_documents USING btree (dump_id, schema_version)

Triggers.Name: lsif_data_documents_schema_versions_insert

Tables.Name: lsif_data_metadata
Tables.Comment: Stores the number of result chunks associated with a dump.

Columns.Name: dump_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the associated dump in the lsif_uploads table (state=completed).

Columns.Name: num_result_chunks
Columns.Comment: A bound of populated indexes in the lsif_data_result_chunks table for the associated dump. This value is used to hash identifiers into the result chunk index to which they belong.

Indexes.Name: lsif_data_metadata_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX lsif_data_metadata_pkey ON lsif_data_metadata USING btree (dump_id)

Tables.Name: lsif_data_result_chunks
Tables.Comment: Associates result set identifiers with the (document path, range identifier) pairs that compose the set.

Columns.Name: data
Columns.Comment: A gob-encoded payload conforming to the [ResultChunkData](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph@3.26/-/blob/enterprise/lib/codeintel/semantic/types.go#L76:6) type.

Columns.Name: dump_id
Columns.Comment: The identifier of the associated dump in the lsif_uploads table (state=completed).

Columns.Name: idx
Columns.Comment: The unique result chunk index within the associated dump. Every result set identifier present should hash to this index (modulo lsif_data_metadata.num_result_chunks).

Indexes.Name: lsif_data_result_chunks_pkey
Indexes.IndexDefinition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX lsif_data_result_chunks_pkey ON lsif_data_result_chunks USING btree (dump_id, idx)
